org.openbase.jul.pattern

Interface Remote<M>

  • Type Parameters:
    M - the data type of the remote
    All Superinterfaces:
    Activatable, DataProvider<M>, Lockable, Shutdownable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ConfigurableRemote<ID,M,CONFIG>, IdentifiableRemote<ID,M>, RegistryRemote<M>, RSBRemote<M>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConfigurableRemote, AbstractIdentifiableRemote, AbstractOpenHABRemote, RSBRemoteService

    public interface Remote<M>
extends Shutdownable, Activatable, Lockable, DataProvider<M>
    Author:
    Divine Threepwood

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        void activate(boolean waitForData)
       throws CouldNotPerformException,
              InterruptedException
        Method activates the remote instance and blocks until the first data synchronization is done. Equivalent of: activate(); waitForData(0); Caution: Method can blocks forever if the related main controller instance will be never available!
        Parameters:
        waitForData - if this flag is true the method will block until the first data synchronization is done.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - if the activation could not be performed
        InterruptedException - if the activation is interrupted

      • addConnectionStateObserver

        void addConnectionStateObserver(Observer<Remote.ConnectionState> observer)
        This method allows the registration of connection state observers to get informed about connection state changes.
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer added

      • removeConnectionStateObserver

        void removeConnectionStateObserver(Observer<Remote.ConnectionState> observer)
        This method removes already registered connection state observers.
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer removed

      • getDataClass

        Class<M> getDataClass()
        Method returns the class of the data object.
        Specified by:
        getDataClass in interface DataProvider<M>
        Returns:
        the class of the data object

      • getData

        M getData()
   throws NotAvailableException
        Method returns the data object of this remote which is synchronized with the server data in background. In case the data was never received not available a NotAvailableException is thrown. Use method getDataFuture() to get feedback about the synchronization state, or use method waitForData() to block until the needed data is synchronized.
        Specified by:
        getData in interface DataProvider<M>
        Returns:
        the data object of the remote.
        Throws:
        NotAvailableException - is thrown in case the data is not yet synchronized with the main controller instance.

      • getDataFuture

        default CompletableFuture<M> getDataFuture()
        Returns a future of the data object. This method can be useful after remote initialization in case the data object was not received jet. The future can be used to wait for the data object.
        Specified by:
        getDataFuture in interface DataProvider<M>
        Returns:
        a future object delivering the data if available.

      • waitForData

        void waitForData()
          throws CouldNotPerformException,
                 InterruptedException
        Method blocks until an initial data message was received from the remote controller.
        Specified by:
        waitForData in interface DataProvider<M>
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown if any error occurs.
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread is externally interrupted.

      • waitForData

        void waitForData(long timeout,
                 TimeUnit timeUnit)
          throws CouldNotPerformException,
                 InterruptedException
        Method blocks until an initial data message was received from the main controller or the given timeout is reached.
        Specified by:
        waitForData in interface DataProvider<M>
        Parameters:
        timeout - maximal time to wait for the main controller data. After the timeout is reached a NotAvailableException is thrown which is caused by a TimeoutException.
        timeUnit - the time unit of the timeout.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown in case the any error occurs, or if the given timeout is reached. In this case a TimeoutException is thrown.
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread is externally interrupted.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Checks if a server connection is established.
        Returns:
        is true in case the connection is established.

      • getConnectionState

        Remote.ConnectionState getConnectionState()
        Method returns the current connection state between this remote and its main controller.
        Returns:
        the current connection state.

      • requestData

        CompletableFuture<M> requestData()
                          throws CouldNotPerformException
        This method synchronizes this remote instance with the main controller and returns the new data object. Normally, all server data changes are automatically synchronized to all remote instances. In case you have triggered many server changes, this changes are sequentially applied. With this method you can force the sync to get instantly a data object with all applied changes. This action can not be canceled! Use this method with caution because high frequently calls will reduce the network performance! The preferred by to access the data object
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture which gives feedback about the successful synchronization.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - In case the sync could not be triggered an CouldNotPerformException will be thrown.
